deck.title: Toddler performs Michael Jackson dance at talent show
deck.note: Watch as 6-year-old Willie performs a flawless dance routine set to Michael Jackson's hit song, "Smooth Criminal", during the Coolidge Elementary School talent show. Now that's impressive!

deck.title: 300 Feet Above Victoria Falls
deck.note: Balancing on a one-inch wide webbing in dizzy heights right in front of the world-famous Victoria Falls in Zimbabwe, Africa is an extraordinary dream that has come true for two professional slackliners.

title: The 10 Greatest Super Bowl Plays Of All Time

data.title: The 10 Greatest Super Bowl Plays Of All Time

deck.title: John Elway's "Helicopter" Scramble Spin
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XXXII (32) | January 25, 1998

Venue: Qualcomm Stadium, San Diego, CA

Before Peyton Manning was breaking passing records out in Denver, it was John Elway who called the shots as the Broncos legendary signal caller from 1983 to 1998.

In his last year playing in the league, Elway made it to the Super Bowl where he he scrambled down in the red zone for a gain that ended with a big hit.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Desmond Howard's 100-yard Touchdown Return
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XXXI (31) | January 26, 1997

Venue: Louisiana Superdome, New Orleans, LA

It doesnt feel like too long ago when Desmond Howard was in the NFL returning kicks and scoring touchdowns, as we most remember his signature moment in Super Bowl XXXI. Des ended up walking away with MVP honors, finishing with 154 yards returning and one game-changing touchdown.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: JCVD FTW
deck.note: And a mind to master the most epic of splits.

deck.title: John Riggins Scores On 4th And 1
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XVII (17) | January 30, 1983

Venue: Rose Bowl Stadium, Pasadena, CA

Back when power running was actually a thing in the NFL, Redskins back John Riggins showed us what real football looks like when he bulldozed his way to a 43-yard score on a pivotal 4th and 1 situation. Showing what a perfectly executed play looks like, the run was a thing of beauty. Seeing all 11 players execute perfectly like that only happens every once in a while.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Devin Hester's Kickoff Return To Start The Game
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XLI (41) | February 4, 2007

Venue: Dolphin Stadium, Miami Gardens, FL

Devin Hester tore the lid off Super Bowl XLI by returning the opening kickoff for a touchdown, putting the Bears up 7-0 over the Colts in just the opening seconds of the game. Making one good move after another, no one was catching Hester out in the open field.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Joe Montana's Game-Winning Drive And TD Pass To John Taylor
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XXIII (23) | January 22, 1989

Venue: Joe Robbie Stadium, Miami, FL

During the final drive of Super Bowl XXIII, we saw the best of Joe Montana and the 49ers. With old reliable Jerry Rice converting on a couple of key receptions, Montana found John Taylor in the back of the endzone to seal the game just after a Bengals scoring drive.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Mike Jones Tackles Kevin Dyson At The 1-Yard Line To Save The Game
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XXXIV (34) | January 30, 2000

Venue: Georgia Dome, Atlanta, GA

They say defense wins championships and at Super Bowl XXXIV. With Steve McNair closing in on scoring late to steal the game, the Titans literally came within one yard of tying the game to force overtime. McNair set his team up to win when receiver Kevin Dyson got denied by linebacker Mike Jones at the goal line.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Santonio Holmes' Game-Winning, Toe-Drag Touchdown
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XLIII (43) | February 1, 2009

Venue: Raymond James Stadium, Tampa, FL

When healthy, Santonio Holmes is an elite receiver. His Super Bowl XLIII matchup against Larry Fitzgerald was one for the ages, as the two went blow-for-blow. Holmes who had the last laugh, reeling in a clutch 6-yard pass from Ben Roethlisberger to ice the game. The toe drag proved that Santonio was good for the count.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Eli Manning's Evasion And David Tyree's Impossible Helmet Catch
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XLII (42) | February 3, 2008

Venue: University of Phoenix Stadium, Glendale, AZ

Eli Manning’s tenacity was just as big a part of this play as David Tyree’s unbelievable catch itself. When all hope was lost, goofy ass Eli emerged out of the would-be sack and launched a prayer. That play kept the drive alive and led to a Plaxico Burress touchdown-reception to win the game.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: James Harrison's 100-yard Interception Return For Touchdown
deck.note:
Super Bowl: XLIII (43) | February 1, 2009

Venue: Raymond James Stadium, Tampa, FL

James Harrison’s 100-yard interception return for a touchdown right before the half of Super Bowl XLIII could be the greatest football play of all time. With Kurt Warner about to strike from the redzone, Harrison etched his legacy by bullying his way the distance to give the Steelers the advantage that decided the game.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

title: The 7 Most Legendary Pro Wrestling Intros Of All Time

data.title: The 7 Most Legendary Pro Wrestling Intros Of All Time

deck.title: The Brood
deck.note:
Before there was “Twilight” or any of these dumbass vampire shows on TV, there was The Brood. The trio of Gangrel, Christian and Edge had a demonic approach to entering the ring as their intro starts off with them rising from the ground into a circle of fire. I always wondered how they did that!

Then of course, Gangrel goes into the ring and spews red “blood” all over the front row to close it. Sitting front row at a wrestling match doesnt sound like a good idea.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Rey Mysterio
deck.note:
Rey Mysterio is notoriously a sneaky, little bastard. You never know when he’s going to pop up, but once he does, the minuscule Mexican emerges from under and hops up like a little chupacabra.

His Wrestlemania XXII entrance was one of the best as he showed up with his own band singing a classic tune dedicated to his 619 San Diego area code. Rey Mysterio is a veteran and his entrance is still one of the best in the game.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Kane
deck.note:
No wrestler can intimidate like Kane. Not only did we have no idea what his face looked like for over a decade, but he always came out disheveled and looking like he was just finishing some terrible, cannibalistic act.

Today, he enters with about half a dozen officers who uncuff him when he gets to the ring. Then as his signature, he does his four-turnbuckle pyro throwdown that lets you know exactly what time it is. Kane has some of the most mesmerizing pyros in the game!

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Eddie Guerrero
deck.note:
First of all, RIP. Eddie Guerrero was a true warrior and fan favorite, especially with such a classic ass intro. Coming down with the straight cholo music bumping in his lowrider with the fuzzy dice and hydraulics, Eddie was one of the greatest entertainers of his time.

Not to mention, he was also one of the greatest champions in WWE history. His spirit lives on!

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Stacy Keibler
deck.note:
Stacy Keibler is one of the most stunning women ever to grace the ring, which makes sense considering that she was able to go beyond her career and become a model and an actress. But it was her signature entrance that did a lot for her career, as most people noticed her because of it.

I mean, how could you miss a 6-foot blonde chick bending over to get into the ring? She really went places because of it!

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: The Rock
deck.note:
The Rock is the most electrifying man in sports entertainment. But it’s not just his theme song or routine that make him special, as he just has one of the craziest auras in the world.

No one does it like him. Who’s trying to compete with that, John Cena? Once you hear, “IF YOU SMELLLL,” you know exactly what time it is.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?

deck.title: Degeneration X
deck.note:
DX has the best entrance of all time. Straight up. Starting off with the infamous “Are you ready?” line, you already know what time it is once the lights turn green.

With Triple H and Shawne Michaels already making the list, you’d be sure that once they come together, itd be a classic. In 2009, they took their production to the next level by adding soldiers and even their own army tank to get to the ring.

ballot.prompt: What did you think of this video?
